oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Deed transfer from Lee Shute to William Dickinson Shute
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Deed of gift written by Lee Shute transferring land and property to his son, William Dickson Shute, in exchange for five dollars. The exchange was a wedding gift to William and his bride, Lavinia Lafayette Hilliard, and included the Grassmere home.
The parcel of land given to William Dickinson Shute was originally part of 640 acres granted to William Simpson by North Carolina under land grant number 174 in 1786.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Shute, Lee
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Deeds; Real property--Tennessee--Davidson County
